intro: Alaticaulia acrochordonia, commonly known as the warty-stemmed acrochordon, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, warty stems that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough, hairy texture. Alaticaulia acrochordonia is native to arid and semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
